ajxpcore.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Uploaders Options]
ajxpcore.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Options shared by all uploaders plugins]

global_param.name: ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Extensions List]
global_param.description: Filter the files that are allowed to be uploaded, by extensions. Use a comma-separated list.

global_param.name: ALLOWED_EXTENSIONS_READABLE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Ext. Label]
global_param.description: User readable label for the list of allowed extensions (images, all files, etc).

global_param.name: UPLOAD_MAX_NUMBER
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Files Number]
global_param.description: Maximum number of files for each upload. Leave to 0 for no limit.

global_param.name: UPLOAD_MAX_SIZE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[File Size]
global_param.description: Maximum size per file allowed to upload. By default, this is fixed by php config 'upload_max_filesize'. Use this one only if you want to set it smaller than the php config. If you want to increase the php value, please check the PHP documentation for how to set a php config. Use either the php config syntax with letters for size (e.g. '2M' for 2MegaBytes , '1G' for one gigabyte, etc.) or an integer value like 2097152 for 2 megabytes.

global_param.name: UPLOAD_MAX_SIZE_TOTAL
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Cumul. Size]
global_param.description: Maximum total size (all files size cumulated) by upload. Leave to 0 if you do not want any limit. See the previous variable for syntax ('2M' or 2097152 )
